block.p: INTERNATIONAL

The Fed fined Ghaith Pharaon $37 million for concealing B.C.C.I.'s acquisition of Independence Bank in 1985. Regulators also moved to freeze Pharaon's assets amid indications that he was selling off his U.S. holdings. [ Page A1. ] The new management of Independence Bank has filed a lawsuit contending that it was secretly acquired by B.C.C.I., using Pharaon as a front man. [ D4. ]

Allstate says it is leaving New Jersey because of overregulation. But some studies suggest a big part of the problem may be that the state is the worst place to drive and insure a car. [ B1. ] Allstate may have reported large overall losses in New Jersey, mainly in auto insurance. But new data suggest that the culprit may be the company's inability to hold down claims. [ B4. ] Across the state, thousands of jittery customers flooded Allstate offices with questions. [ B4. ]
